com.extjs.gxt.ui.client.viewer
Class ViewerFilter<P,E>

java.lang.Object
  com.extjs.gxt.ui.client.viewer.ViewerFilter<P,E>

public abstract class ViewerFilter<P,E>
extends java.lang.Object

A viewer filter is used by a viewer to extract a subset of elements provided by its content provider.

This code is based on JFace API from the Eclipse Project.

See Also:
ContentProvider, Viewer

Method Summary
 java.util.List<java.lang.Object> filter(Viewer viewer, P parent, java.util.List<E> elements)
          Filters the given elements for the given viewer.
abstract  boolean select(Viewer viewer, P parentElement, E element)
          Returns whether the given element makes it through this filter.

Method Detail

filter

public java.util.List<java.lang.Object> filter(Viewer viewer,
                                               P parent,
                                               java.util.List<E> elements)
Filters the given elements for the given viewer. The input array is not modified.

The default implementation of this method calls select on each element in the array, and returns only those elements for which select returns true.

Parameters:
viewer - the viewer
parent - the parent element
elements - the elements to filter
Returns:
the filtered elements

select

public abstract boolean select(Viewer viewer,
                               P parentElement,
                               E element)
Returns whether the given element makes it through this filter.

Parameters:
viewer - the viewer
parentElement - the parent element
element - the element
Returns:
true if element is included in the filtered set, and false if excluded
